title: Could one pass the GED without studying? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi Dustin, Some say they’ve passed with virtually no studying, so YES, it can be done! That being said, paying to test for each section can get pretty expensive, and having to retake sections gets even more expensive! There are plenty of free or very cheap resources out there, so it’s not a bad idea to at least look at some of these! Again, the main reason I suggest this is because of the cost! Having to pay to retake due to not being fully prepared the first time is never fun lol. Not saying you won’t pass the first time, but just think about the extra money it will cost if you have to pay to retake vs the extra time to at least check out some free resources now. It’s your call though, so go with your gut! Do whatever works for you! Good luck!!

Yes. I did (in 2009) and I know many people who did as well. Now, this was in the mid and late 2000s before the new rules and format. That said, I'm pretty confident that even though the GED test is a tad bit harder than it used to be that there are people who pass it with little or no studying. You don't need to be a genius to do well on the GED test just a descent test taker. This I know from personal experience, I still don't know how I passed the math part of the test. Lol. I hope this answers your questions :)

I did. I am diabetic and had really low blood sugars the first day, but somehow managed to pass the first two tests, though I did not know that at the time. The second day of testing came, and I ensured that my blood sugar was at a reasonable level before taking the examination. I went into the testing center to take the final two exams. My lowest score was something like a 158 and my highest was 171. Neither were good, but they were enough to pass the exam and get me into community college.

Can some people do well on the GED without studying? Absolutely. Me, for example. Can you? Well, I’d recommend at least looking at the practice exams to make sure you’re up to the task. Just in case there are some areas where you need to brush up your skills.
